isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3000FE, 3000RE - 3000FE LIGHT SYSTEMS - DESCRIPTION

svcsubproc.title: Back-Up Lights
svcsubproc.para: The vehicle back-up lights are a set of lamps that come on when the vehicle transmission is shifted into reverse. This allows the driver to see while backing when dark.

svcsubproc.title: Headlight System
svcsubproc.para: A headlight system along with a turn signal lever controlled dimmer switch is provided for illumination while driving.

svcsubproc.title: Panel Lights
svcsubproc.para: The instrument panel lights and the automatic transmission shift light are low wattage bulbs and the brightness of these lights are controlled by the panel light switch.

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signal System
svcsubproc.para: The turn signal system provides a driver with the means to signal oncoming or following traffic of intended lane changes.

svcsubproc.title: Daytime Running Lights
svcsubproc.para: The Daytime Running light feature allows the vehicle to operate in a "Lights On" condition at all times without driver input. This system operates the headlights at partial illumination but still helps to increase visibility even in bright sunshine.
